About Me Projects Resume

Hi there! üëã

I'm Guillermo, originally from Barcelona (Spain) and currently living in Munich (Germany).

I'm a software engineer with a passion for mobile development and a strong background in mobile devops. I am passionate about building high-quality mobile applications that deliver exceptional user experiences.

Code

My bread and butter is Swift and I've been working with it since 2016. I also have experience with other languages like Python, Ruby, JS or Bash.

DevOps

Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines is one of my favorite things to do. I have experience with GitHub Actions, CircleCI, and Bitrise. I tend to look for developer experience and automation in everything I do.

Beyond mobile

My main focus is mobile development, but I also have experience with cloud infrastructure and databases. AWS, SQL, Firebase, or this website. You name it!

Featured Projects

Capmo

Check it out
  • Offline first app
  • Swift
  • SwiftUI
  • SQLite
  • DataDog
  • GraphQL
  • CircleCI
  • Fastlane

Capmo is a SaaS that targets construction professionals and general contractors.

  • Bootstrapped iOS project at Capmo.
  • POC with several "off-the-shelf" offline-first frameworks like AWS Amplify and MongoDB Realm.
  • Ideation and implementation of a custom offline-first sync mechanism.
  • Test automation (Unit, Snapshot, and UI).
  • Implementation of best practices in the development workflow (Gitflow, Swiftformat, Swiftlint, Danger, CodeClimate).
  • Modularization of the app using internal Swift Packages.
  • Implementation and maintenance of the CI/CD pipeline (Fastlane, GitHub Actions, and CircleCI).
  • Implementation of observability and debugging tools (Firebase and Datadog).

MindDoc

Check it out
  • Swift
  • SwiftUI
  • Firebase
  • RESTful
  • GitHub Actions
  • Fastlane

MindDoc is an app for those who want to learn about emotional well-being or who suffer from mild-to-moderate mental illness including depression, anxiety, insomnia, and eating disorders.

  • Maintenance and development of new features for the MindDoc iOS App, covered by unit, snapshot, and functional tests.
  • Refactoring and updating following clean code principles.
  • Improved CI/CD workflow and branching system.
  • Reduction of external dependencies.
